newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai Airways to invest in cargo company.
newsitem.headline: Thai Airways to invest in cargo company.

text.p: The Thai Cabinet on Tuesday approved a proposal to allow Thai Airways International Plc to hold a stake in a new cargo company, a senior official said.

The new company, Thai Air Cargo Co Ltd, which will operate a cargo airliner, will have initial capital of one billion baht ($40 million), 50 percent of which will be paid up in the first year, a senior official at Thai Airways International told reporters.
The official did not give a specific time when the new company would be set up.

Thai Airways will hold a 40 percent stake in the new company. Thai Military Bank will take 24 percent of the shares and the remainder will be held by two private institutional investors, the official said.
Thai Airways is Thailand's national carrier and is 93 percent owned by the finance ministry. ($1=25 baht)
